sense.name: submerge, inundate
sense.examples: Flooding has swamped the Upper Midwest and Plains. It had gone only a few hundred feet when the boat was swamped by the immense waves.

sense.name: overwhelm with an excess of something
sense.examples: I am just swamped with work! A horrible, crushing grief swamped the room. Declining issues swamped advancers, 1,222 to 382.
